response.answer_text: “How do I network 200 computers?” That depends on what you want out of the 200 computers. The simple case would be gathering 8–16 per router, 8–16 routers together and use multiple such trees until you get all 200 connected. Then it depends on whether you have one network configuration or dozens. If one, then a single DHCP server and backup might be able to work. If dozens, then you need dozens of DHCP servers… If you are making a cluster, get the cluster software you want and read the directions for it. It really REALLY depends on what you want, because there are many different ways to do it.
It really depends on what you need. How exactly do you need to organise them. Give some more details and I can give you useful suggestions.
